TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AudioFocus extends System.Enum

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus Gain = int32(1)

summary.para: Used to indicate a gain of audio focus, or a request of audio focus, of unknown duration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus GainTransient = int32(2)

summary.para: Used to indicate a temporary gain or request of audio focus, anticipated to last a short amount of time. Examples of temporary changes are the playback of driving directions, or an event notification.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus GainTransientMayDuck = int32(3)

summary.para: Used to indicate a temporary request of audio focus, anticipated to last a short amount of time, and where it is acceptable for other audio applications to keep playing after having lowered their output level (also referred to as "ducking"). Examples of temporary changes are the playback of driving directions where playback of music in the background is acceptable.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus Loss = int32(-1)

summary.para: Used to indicate a loss of audio focus of unknown duration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus LossTransient = int32(-2)

summary.para: Used to indicate a transient loss of audio focus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus LossTransientCanDuck = int32(-3)

summary.para: Used to indicate a transient loss of audio focus where the loser of the audio focus can lower its output volume if it wants to continue playing (also referred to as "ducking"), as the new focus owner doesn't require others to be silent.
